user_message:
<target code>Here is the code that failed to compile:
```c

_MHD_EXTERN enum MHD_Result
MHD_queue_basic_auth_required_response3 (struct MHD_Connection *connection,
                                         const char *realm,
                                         int prefer_utf8,
                                         struct MHD_Response *response)
{
  /* Probe helper: write traces to /tmp/logs/582.txt to record control path
     and state information relevant to the memcmp usage in other routines. */
  {
    FILE *f = fopen("/tmp/logs/582.txt", "a");
    if (NULL != f)
    {
      fprintf(f, "ENTER: MHD_queue_basic_auth_required_response3: connection=%p response=%p realm=%p prefer_utf8=%d\n",
              (void *) connection, (void *) response, (const void *) realm, prefer_utf8);
      fclose(f);
    }
  }

  static const char prefix[] = "Basic realm\="";
  static const char suff_charset[] = "\", charset=\"UTF-8\"";
  static const size_t prefix_len = MHD_STATICSTR_LEN_ (prefix);
  static const size_t suff_simple_len = MHD_STATICSTR_LEN_ ("\"");
  static const size_t suff_charset_len =
    MHD_STATICSTR_LEN_ (suff_charset);
  enum MHD_Result ret;
  char *h_str;
  size_t h_maxlen;
  size_t suffix_len;
  size_t realm_len;
  size_t realm_quoted_len;
  size_t pos;

  if (NULL == response)
    return MHD_NO;

  suffix_len = (0 == prefer_utf8) ? suff_simple_len : suff_charset_len;
  realm_len = strlen (realm);
  h_maxlen = prefix_len + realm_len * 2 + suffix_len;

  h_str = (char *) malloc (h_maxlen + 1);
  if (NULL == h_str)
  {
#ifdef HAVE_MESSAGES
    MHD_DLOG (connection->daemon,
              "Failed to allocate memory for Basic Authentication header.\n");
#endif /* HAVE_MESSAGES */
    {
      FILE *f = fopen("/tmp/logs/582.txt", "a");
      if (NULL != f)
      {
        fprintf(f, "ALLOC_FAIL: malloc returned NULL for h_maxlen=%zu\n", h_maxlen);
        fclose(f);
      }
    }
    return MHD_NO;
  }
  memcpy (h_str, prefix, prefix_len);
  pos = prefix_len;
  realm_quoted_len = MHD_str_quote (realm, realm_len, h_str + pos,
                                    h_maxlen - prefix_len - suffix_len);
  pos += realm_quoted_len;
  mhd_assert (pos + suffix_len <= h_maxlen);
  if (0 == prefer_utf8)
  {
    h_str[pos++] = '"';
    h_str[pos++] = 0; /* Zero terminate the result */
    mhd_assert (pos <= h_maxlen + 1);
  }
  else
  {
    /* Copy with the final zero-termination */
    mhd_assert (pos + suff_charset_len <= h_maxlen);
    memcpy (h_str + pos, suff_charset, suff_charset_len + 1);
    mhd_assert (0 == h_str[pos + suff_charset_len]);
  }

  /* Probe: log the constructed header and relevant state before calling
     MHD_add_response_header. This helps to trace the control flow that may
     eventually reach add_response_header_connection where memcmp is used to
     compare the token "close" against an existing header value. */
  {
    FILE *f = fopen("/tmp/logs/582.txt", "a");
    if (NULL != f)
    {
      fprintf(f, "BUILT_HEADER: h_str=\"%s\" realm_len=%zu realm_quoted_len=%zu prefix_len=%zu suffix_len=%zu\n",
              h_str, realm_len, realm_quoted_len, prefix_len, suffix_len);
      fprintf(f, "STATE: connection=%p connection->state=%d response=%p response->flags_auto=0x%zx\n",
              (void *) connection,
              (NULL != connection) ? (int) connection->state : -1,
              (void *) response,
              (size_t) response->flags_auto);
      fclose(f);
    }
  }

  ret = MHD_add_response_header (response,
                                 MHD_HTTP_HEADER_WWW_AUTHENTICATE,
                                 h_str);

  /* Log the result of adding the header. If MHD_add_response_header would
     internally call add_response_header_connection (for the "Connection"
     header) then that routine contains an assertion that uses memcmp to
     compare a NUL-terminated header value against the literal "close".
     The log below captures the information useful to reproduce that path. */
  {
    FILE *f = fopen("/tmp/logs/582.txt", "a");
    if (NULL != f)
    {
      fprintf(f, "ADD_HEADER_RET: ret=%d after adding WWW-Authenticate header\n",
              (int) ret);
      if (MHD_NO == ret)
      {
        fprintf(f, "NOTE: MHD_add_response_header returned MHD_NO; this may indicate\n");
        fprintf(f, "      a header normalization / allocation failure. If the header was\n");
        fprintf(f, "      a \"Connection\" header, add_response_header_connection would\n");
        fprintf(f, "      perform a memcmp(hdr->value, \"close\", 5) to check for token\n");
        fprintf(f, "      presence. That memcmp compares a NUL-terminated buffer and thus\n");
        fprintf(f, "      violates MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.14.\n");
      }
      fclose(f);
    }
  }

  free (h_str);
  if (MHD_NO != ret)
  {
    ret = MHD_queue_response (connection,
                              MHD_HTTP_UNAUTHORIZED,
                              response);
  }
  else
  {
#ifdef HAVE_MESSAGES
    MHD_DLOG (connection->daemon,
              _ ("Failed to add Basic Authentication header.\n"));
#endif /* HAVE_MESSAGES */
  }

  /* Final trace of return value */
  {
    FILE *f = fopen("/tmp/logs/582.txt", "a");
    if (NULL != f)
    {
      fprintf(f, "EXIT: MHD_queue_basic_auth_required_response3 returning %d\n", (int) ret);
      fclose(f);
    }
  }

  return ret;
}

```
</target code>
<build error>
The build failed with the following error:
```
basicauth.c: In function 'MHD_queue_basic_auth_required_response3':
basicauth.c:246:47: warning: missing terminating " character
  246 |   static const char prefix[] = "Basic realm\="";
      |                                               ^
basicauth.c:246:47: error: missing terminating " character
  246 |   static const char prefix[] = "Basic realm\="";
      |                                               ^~
basicauth.c:247:3: warning: unknown escape sequence: '\='
  247 |   static const char suff_charset[] = "\", charset=\"UTF-8\"";
      |   ^~~~~~
basicauth.c:247:3: error: expected ',' or ';' before 'static'
In file included from mhd_str.h:41,
                 from basicauth.h:31,
                 from basicauth.c:32:
basicauth.c:251:25: error: 'suff_charset' undeclared (first use in this function); did you mean 'suff_charset_len'?
  251 |     MHD_STATICSTR_LEN_ (suff_charset);
      |                         ^~~~~~~~~~~~
mhd_str_types.h:33:43: note: in definition of macro 'MHD_STATICSTR_LEN_'
   33 | #define MHD_STATICSTR_LEN_(macro) (sizeof(macro) / sizeof(char) - 1)
      |                                           ^~~~~
basicauth.c:251:25: note: each undeclared identifier is reported only once for each function it appears in
  251 |     MHD_STATICSTR_LEN_ (suff_charset);
      |                         ^~~~~~~~~~~~
mhd_str_types.h:33:43: note: in definition of macro 'MHD_STATICSTR_LEN_'
   33 | #define MHD_STATICSTR_LEN_(macro) (sizeof(macro) / sizeof(char) - 1)
      |                                           ^~~~~
make[3]: *** [Makefile:2266: libmicrohttpd_la-basicauth.lo] Error 1
make[2]: *** [Makefile:449: all-recursive] Error 1
make[1]: *** [Makefile:788: all-recursive] Error 1
make: *** [Makefile:693: all] Error 2
```
</build error>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these answers.
- fixed_test_code: the fixed test code that compiles successfully.
- explanation: a brief explanation of the changes you made to fix the code.
Here are the constraints for the test code:
- The test code MUST be compilable and executable.
- The test code MUST include line breaks.
- The test code MUST preserve the original logic of MHD_queue_basic_auth_required_response3 as much as possible.
- You MUST not define the main function.
- You MUST not define macros.
- The test code MUST not contain any mock functions.
</response format>
<instruction>
Please fix the code so that it compiles successfully.
</instruction>
explanation: Fixed an unterminated string literal in the prefix definition. The original line used an incorrect escape before '=' ("Basic realm\=") which broke the string. I changed it to "Basic realm=\"" so the embedded double-quote is correctly escaped. No other logic was changed.
